sources.title: The Little American
sources.description: During the first world war, a young American woman's boat is torpedoed by a German U-Boat. When she manages to return to her ancestral country of France, she witnesses the German atrocities first hand. This is Wallace Beery's first screen appearance (he plays a German soldier) Stars: Mary Pickford, Jack Holt, Hobart Bosworth, Ben Alexander Directed by Cecil B Demille An Artcraft Picture

Produced by Famous Players-Lasky Corp., this World War I drama showcases the early brilliance of legendary director Cecil B. DeMille. Silent screen icon Mary Pickford delivers a heartfelt performance as Angela Moore, a young American passenger on a boat torpedoed by the Germans at the onset of World War I. Trapped by the enemy in a French chateau, she bravely faces the horrors of war and the pain of heartbreak. 

With sweeping battle scenes, gripping espionage, and stirring patriotism, this film exemplifies the power of early cinema to blend romance with the harsh realities of global conflict. metadata.Plot: German-American Karl and French-American Jules are in love with Angela when each returns to his country as war breaks out. She sails for France and while there is nearly raped by Karl as the Germans invade. She is later arrested for sending secret messages to Jules but Karl defends her. Both are saved from execution by the arrival of the French forces and Count Jules
